description: Mailappuge Ananda Karunarathna Vs. The Attorney General before Hon. AmalRanaraja, J.
parties: Mailappuge Ananda Karunarathna Vs. The Attorney General
keywords: Grave sexual abuse on a minor – Minimum mandatory sentence - Discretion of a Trial Judge to reach a conclusion as regards to a sentence is not inhibited or controlled by a mandatory sentence imposed by a stature,  however there should be some adequate reasons to do so – Aggravating circumstances present,  public interest demands that a custodial sentence be imposed on the appellant as convictions for grave sexual abuse carries significant implications not just for the victim but for the society as a whole – The legal consequences imposed on individuals convicted of grave sexual abuse are designed to reflect the seriousness of the crime.
legistation: -	Section 365 B(2)(b) of the Penal code (as amended).
